contentrichtext.text: '''Makedonia''', '''Makedonija''' or '''Makedoniya''' are names used for '''[[Macedonia (region)|Macedonia]]''' by peoples within the region.<ref>The name is spelled Μακεδονία (transliterated ''Makedonia'') in Greek, Македонија (officially transliterated as ''Makedonija'', but sometimes also ''Makedonia'' or ''Makedoniya'') in Macedonian, and Македония (officially transliterated as ''Makedonia'' [http://transliteration.mdaar.government.bg/database-view.php?task=view&let=%CC&page=11], but also ''Makedonija'' or ''Makedoniya'') in Bulgarian.</ref> It may also refer to: * [[Makedonia (newspaper)]], a Greek newspaper * [[Makedonia (Bulgarian newspaper)]], or ''Makedoniya'', a 19th century Bulgarian newspaper from Istanbul * [[Nova Makedonija]], or "''New Macedonia''", a newspaper from the Republic of Macedonia * [[Makedonia TV]], a Greek television station * [[Makedonia (dance)]], a Greek dance song * [[FK Makedonija Gjorče Petrov]], a football (soccer) club in the Republic of Macedonia *{{MV|Makedonia}}, a Greek passenger ship in service 1984-85 See also: * [[Macedonia (disambiguation)]] ;Notes {{reflist}} {{disambig}}
